meanings.definition: Stretching out one's neck in order to see something better.
meanings.sent1: The little girl was craning her neck to see the parade over the crowd.
meanings.sent2: I found myself craning my neck to catch a glimpse of the movie screen.
meanings.sent3: The curious puppy kept craning its neck to peek into the neighbor's yard.
meanings.sent4: The sunflower was craning its head towards the sunlight, reaching for warmth.
meanings.sent5: She was craning her neck so much that she ended up with a sore throat.

meanings.definition: Using a crane to lift or move heavy objects.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers were craning the steel beams into place with precision.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to start craning the equipment to the top floor for installation.
meanings.sent3: The crane operator was craning the massive container with ease, impressing the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The crane was craning the heavy load effortlessly, showcasing its strength.
meanings.sent5: They were craning the fragile sculpture delicately to its designated spot in the gallery.

meanings.definition: Moving or extending something in a curved or angular way.
meanings.sent1: The tree branches were craning towards the sunlight filtering through the canopy.
meanings.sent2: The snake was craning its body to reach the prey hidden in the crevice.
meanings.sent3: The caterpillar was craning its neck to nibble on the leaf just out of reach.
meanings.sent4: The river was craning around the bend, meandering through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's arms were craning gracefully as she moved across the stage.
